intro: Siphocampylus uncipes, commonly known as the slenderleaf scabious, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale blue. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Siphocampylus uncipes thrives in dry, open habitats and is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
